translation.en: [narrator] In just two weeks,
the German Army storms across France and Belgium,
translation.zh: ‎德国军队席卷了法国和比利时

translation.en: pushing hundreds of thousands of British and French soldiers
translation.zh: ‎把几十万英国和法国士兵逼到

translation.en: to the sea at Dunkirk.
They have revolutionized warfare.
They've realized that speed of movement is now the key,
translation.zh: ‎他们意识到行动的速度是关键

translation.en: so you create these armored formations that move fast.
translation.zh: ‎所以打造了能快速行进的装甲部队

translation.en: They are harnessing new panzer techniques with radio technology,
translation.zh: ‎他们结合无线电科技与新坦克技术

translation.en: and the support of the Luftwaffe. That's the new thing.
translation.zh:
‎和纳粹空军的支持
‎这些是新鲜事物

translation.en: [narrator] A brutal aerial bombardment...
fast-moving tanks...
a superhuman infantry.
This is Blitzkrieg, lightning war.
[Sonke] "Blitzkrieg", it means speed.
Maneuver Warfare.
A campaign which is focused on a very quick decisive battle.
translation.zh: ‎专注于打快速的决定性的战役

translation.en: [narrator] Blitzkrieg is one of the most
extraordinary events of World War II.
[narrator] Now, rare footage from around the world,
expertly restored in full color, tells the story
translation.zh:
‎在专业的色彩恢复后
‎向您讲述

translation.en: as you've never seen it before.
After their defeat in World War I, the fiercely proud German people
translation.zh:
‎在一战中被打败后
‎非常骄傲的德国人

translation.en: are utterly humiliated.
The punishing terms of the Treaty of Versailles
rub salt in the wounds.
The global industrial power
is limited to an army of only 100,000 men,
and loses territory.
[Geoffrey] The Germans feel very put-upon by the Treaty of Versailles,
translation.zh: ‎德国人沦为《凡尔赛条约》的牺牲品

translation.en: because it essentially says that the Germans are guilty
translation.zh: ‎因为它本质上认为德国人有罪…

translation.en: of starting the war.
[Saul] There's no question that most Germans felt outraged
by the provisions of the Treaty of Versailles,
the shrinking of the army to just 100,000,
and the loss of territory, and these massive reparations,
translation.zh: ‎失去大量领土 受到广泛谴责

translation.en: which everybody knew were gonna have serious economic consequences.
translation.zh: ‎每个人都知道这有巨大的经济影响

translation.en: And the reason they objected was because it implied
translation.zh: ‎而他们拒绝是因为这暗示了

translation.en: that Germany was responsible for the First World War,
and this was their punishment.
[narrator] How could their powerful nation have lost?
translation.zh: ‎为什么他们强大的祖国会输掉？

translation.en: And why are they made to cede land to lesser nations?
translation.zh: ‎为什么要割让领土给更弱小的国家？

translation.en: [Geoffrey] The territorial losses are quite significant.
They lose territory in the East, to the Poles and the Czechs,
and they are forced to demilitarize the Rhineland
so they can't use it as a launch pad for renewed invasion
translation.zh: ‎无法利用它们对比利时和法国

translation.en: of Belgium and France.
[narrator] Feeding on the resentment, a populist rabble-rouser
taps into wounded German pride and promises to take back
translation.zh:
‎利用德国人受伤的自尊心
‎承诺要夺回

translation.en: what has been lost.
Adolf Hitler and his Nazi Party start to build a mass following.
translation.zh:
‎阿尔道夫•希特勒和他的纳粹党
‎开始拥有很多追随者

translation.en: The German people see him as a savior,
a man to restore their once-great nation.
translation.zh: ‎重振这个昔日伟大国家的人

translation.en: There was a feeling in Germany that most Germans felt
translation.zh:
‎在德国有一种氛围
‎大多数德国人感觉

translation.en: when the Versailles Treaty was passed,
that the provisions were unnecessarily draconian,
both the loss of territory, and also these massive war reparations.
And what the Versailles Treaty did, in effect,
is blame Germany for the First World War, whereas many Germans felt that, actually,
translation.zh:
‎是为一战谴责德国
‎而其实大部分德国人

translation.en: they were no more responsible than any of the other countries.
translation.zh: ‎认为他们的责任并不比其他国家多

translation.en: And so, this rankled.
[Geoffrey] Hitler correctly diagnoses that the Germans are suffering
translation.zh: ‎希特勒正确地判断出德国人的痛苦

translation.en: a great deal of political and economic insecurity.
translation.zh: ‎巨大的政治和经济不安全感

translation.en: What they need most of all is a sense of unity
and a sense of economic security as kind of a floor underneath them.
And the Nazis provide this by talking about, you know,
state intervention in all sorts of areas to create employment.
translation.zh: ‎国家干预各行各业来创造就业

translation.en: Building the autobahns, things like that.
[in German] In the first years of Hitler's reign,
translation.zh:
‎希特勒执政第一年
‎大部分德国人认为是成功的…

translation.en: most Germans consider it a success.
translation.zh:
‎希特勒执政第一年
‎大部分德国人认为是成功的… ‎（彼得•利布博士
‎德国波兹坦历史学家）

translation.en: Hitler manages to suspend
the regulations of the Versailles treaty step by step.
[narrator] In violation of the treaty, Hitler builds up his army,
translation.zh:
‎希特勒违反条约规定
‎打造了自己的军队

translation.en: testing the tolerance of the Allies,
gambling that no one wants to start another war.
translation.zh: ‎打赌没有人想再次挑起战争

translation.en: He introduces compulsory military service in 1935
translation.zh: ‎他在一九三五年引入强制服兵役

translation.en: and marches back into the Rhineland the following year
with 30,000 troops.
[Geoffrey] If you think about Hitler's long-term plan,
translation.zh: ‎如果考虑到希特勒的长远计划

translation.en: it's to consolidate his position on the European continent,
translation.zh: ‎是巩固其在欧洲大陆的地位

translation.en: defeat the Western powers, France and Britain,
translation.zh: ‎打败西方强国 法国和英国

translation.en: and then he's gonna turn his attention to the east,
which he sees as the natural field for German expansion,
translation.zh: ‎他将之视为德国扩张的自然结果

translation.en: a place where that he can then build out the German population,
gather in resources, and defeat the monster of Bolshevism,
translation.zh:
‎捕获资源
‎并打败布尔什维克老大

translation.en: which he sees as being kind of the blood enemy of fascism.
translation.zh: ‎他将其视为法西斯主义的宿敌

translation.en: [narrator] When the Nazis brazenly march into Austria
translation.zh: ‎纳粹堂而皇之地进入奥地利

translation.en: on the 12th of March 1938,
translation.zh: ‎那是一九三八年三月十二日

translation.en: they are greeted with open arms by the Austrian people.
translation.zh: ‎奥地利人敞开大门欢迎他们

translation.en: The Western Allies do nothing.
The Western Allies pretty much stood by and let it happen,
translation.zh: ‎西方协约国很大程度上作壁上观

translation.en: and one of the reasons they did that is because they felt
translation.zh: ‎其中一个原因就是他们感觉

translation.en: that the Austrians probably wanted to join with the Germans,
translation.zh: ‎奥地利人可能希望成为德国人

translation.en: therefore they weren't actually being forced.
[Peter Lieb speaking German] The breaches of the Versailles treaty are always grave,
translation.zh: ‎打破《凡尔赛条约》的灾难性的

translation.en: but the Allied forces never react.
Many of them think that they perhaps humiliated Germany
too much with the Versailles treaty.
translation.zh: ‎可能对德国人带来太大的羞辱

translation.en: They can understand that Germany wants to be a major player again.
translation.zh: ‎他们理解德国希望再成为世界大国

translation.en: On the other hand, the Allied countries don't want to risk another war.
translation.zh: ‎另一方面协约国不希望冒险再次开战

translation.en: From the First World War, they know that a war would mean
translation.zh: ‎自一战以来 他们意识到战争意味着

translation.en: thousands, if not millions, of casualties, and they want to prevent that.
translation.zh:
‎至少几万人的伤亡
‎这是他们希望能防止的

translation.en: [narrator] With Austria now in German hands,
Hitler makes public his goal to incorporate areas of Czechoslovakia
translation.zh: ‎希特勒公开宣布要整合捷克斯诺伐克

translation.en: into the growing German footprint.
It's a country rich in natural resources like iron.
translation.zh: ‎这是一个富含铁矿等自然资源的国家

translation.en: The statements alarm the Allies, but still, they want to avoid conflict.
translation.zh:
‎德国的这一宣布提醒了协约国
‎但他们还是希望避免冲突

translation.en: In September 1938,
the British Prime Minister Neville Chamberlain
flies to Germany three times
to attempt to dissuade Hitler from invading Czechoslovakia.
translation.zh: ‎试图劝阻希特勒入侵捷克斯诺伐克

translation.en: I used to repeat...
"If at first you don't succeed,
try, try, try again."
That's what I'm doing.
[narrator] On his third visit,
he joins French Prime Minister Édouard Daladier
translation.zh: ‎他和法国总理爱德华•达拉第

translation.en: and Benito Mussolini of Italy,
translation.zh: ‎意大利贝尼托•墨索里尼一起

translation.en: at what becomes known as the Munich Conference.
translation.zh: ‎这在后来被称为慕尼黑会议

translation.en: They agree with Hitler that Germany can annex
the German-speaking Sudetenland, but not make an attempt
translation.zh:
‎说德语的苏台德地区
‎但不要尝试

translation.en: to invade the rest of Czechoslovakia.
translation.zh: ‎入侵捷克斯诺伐克其余地区

translation.en: The following morning, Chamberlain signs a separate agreement with Hitler;
translation.zh:
‎次日早上
‎张伯伦与希特勒单独签署了

translation.en: a peace deal between Britain and Germany.
Chamberlain is greeted as a hero.
translation.zh: ‎张伯伦回到伦敦赫斯顿机场受到欢迎

translation.en: Chamberlain returns to Heston Airport in London
and waves this piece of paper, sort of talks about peace in our time.
translation.zh:
‎…扬着这一纸协议
‎谈论这个时代的和平

translation.en: And this is a separate deal that he has done privately
translation.zh: ‎这是他和希特勒私下签署的

translation.en: with Hitler.
This morning...
I had another talk...
with the German chancellor, Herr Hitler.
And here is the paper...
which bears his name upon it, as well as mine.
He's averted war. There's absolutely no question
translation.zh: ‎他避免了战争 这是毫无疑问的

translation.en: that Hitler is absolutely chomping at the bit
to go in all guns blazing into Czechoslovakia.
That has been avoided.
We regard the agreement signed last night,
and the Anglo-German Naval Agreement as symbolic of the desire
of our two peoples never to go to war with one another again.
translation.zh:
‎我们两国人民
‎不希望彼此开战的愿望）

translation.en: [narrator] As Chamberlain delivers his speech,
German forces prepare to march into the Sudetenland.
translation.zh: ‎德国军队准备攻入苏德台地区

translation.en: March 1939, Hitler invades the rest of Czechoslovakia.
translation.zh:
‎一九三九年三月
‎希特勒入侵了捷克斯诺伐克其余地区

translation.en: It is clear that Hitler's plan isn't just to regain territory...
translation.zh: ‎显然希特勒的计划不仅是重获领地

translation.en: but to expand Germany's borders further east.
[Saul] Hitler's intention, ultimately, is to create a huge German empire
translation.zh:
‎希特勒最终的目的是
‎打造巨大的德意志帝国

translation.en: in Central and Eastern Europe.
Are they prepared to go to war? So, he's just got to keep pushing,
translation.zh:
‎他们准备好开展了吗？
‎于是他继续

translation.en: slowly but surely, and one after another
translation.zh: ‎缓慢但是坚决推进 一个接一个

translation.en: these crucial countries, Austria, Czechoslovakia,
translation.zh: ‎奥地利和捷克斯诺伐克等重要国家

translation.en: slowly the dominoes will fall, and he's gonna be able
translation.zh:
‎慢慢地多米诺骨牌开始倒下
‎他将会

translation.en: to carve out for himself this huge new empire,
this living room for the German people.
[narrator] France and Britain become increasingly anxious
that Hitler's next move will be Poland.
translation.zh: ‎担心希特勒的下一步会是波兰

translation.en: They draw a line in the sand; if Hitler invades Poland,
translation.zh:
‎他们的底线是 ‎如果希特勒进攻波兰
‎他们就会宣战

translation.en: they will declare war.
translation.zh:
‎如果希特勒进攻波兰
‎他们就会宣战

translation.en: Hitler doesn't believe them.
The German chancellor is more worried about how his avowed enemies,
translation.zh: ‎德国首相更担心的是他的死对头

translation.en: the Soviets, will react.
August 1939, Hitler declares a non-aggression pact
translation.zh:
‎一九三九年八月
‎希特勒和意识形态上的敌人

translation.en: with his ideological enemy, Stalin,
in which they agree not to attack each other.
While the Western Allies struggle to understand this unlikely alliance,
translation.zh:
‎西方同盟国试图理解
‎这一不太可能的结盟

translation.en: on September the first, the two countries reveal their hands
translation.zh: ‎九月一日 这两个国家露出底牌

translation.en: when Hitler invades Western Poland.
The Polish army on their horses are no match for the German panzers,
translation.zh: ‎马背上的波兰军队不敌德国装甲部队

translation.en: but they put up a valiant fight.
Sixteen days later, the Soviet Union invade Poland
from the east.
[Saul] It's a very cynical deal.
What the Russians are gonna get out of it is a free hand and a lot of the east,
translation.zh:
‎苏联希望从中得到的是
‎能攻占东部大量区域

translation.en: including the recovery of some of the territories that they'd lost
at the end of the First World War.
And what the Germans are gonna get out of it
translation.zh: ‎而德国人希望从中得到的是

translation.en: is a free hand to invade Poland
without worry that the Russians are gonna react against that.
In fact, they've done a deal to divide the country up between them.
translation.zh: ‎事实上他们同意将波兰瓜分

translation.en: [narrator] True to their word, on the third of September 1939,
translation.zh: ‎按照其承诺 一九三九年九月三日

translation.en: Britain and France declare war on Germany.
It's a move Hitler didn't see coming.
[Saul] When he actually hears that the United Kingdom's
declared war on him in particular, he's horrified,
translation.zh: ‎专门向他宣战 他吓坏了

translation.en: and he says to one of his advisers, "What next?"
translation.zh: ‎他问一位顾问“接下来怎么办？”

translation.en: Because all along, he hadn't believed
that they would actually go to war over an issue in Eastern Europe.
[narrator] The next day,
troops from the British Expeditionary Force, the BEF,
set sail for France
to join forces with the world's most powerful army.
They move up to the Belgian border
where they prepare for any German attack.
Royal Engineers Private Percy Taylor Beaton,
translation.zh:
‎皇家工兵部队列兵
‎帕西•泰勒•比顿

translation.en: who was called up in London and was soon on a boat
translation.zh: ‎被召到伦敦 很快登上一艘船

translation.en: bound for Cherbourg in France.
[Percy] People cheered, and they made a fuss and that.
There was bags of tears and things like this at people going away.
translation.zh: ‎有人挥洒着眼泪 一派告别的景象…

translation.en: The people in the streets, you know, when they saw us and that they cheered us,
translation.zh: ‎…街上的人看到我们时给我们加油

translation.en: you know, when the coach left Bethnal Green,
the people there, they turned out in their thousands,
and they were cheering us and waving us off.
Everybody didn't think about the war, I don't think.
translation.zh: ‎我想大家都没去想战争的事

translation.en: They thought "Oh, it's gonna pass over."
And then of course, once we got to France, it was like a holiday at the beginning.
translation.zh:
‎当然一旦我们达到法国
‎一开始就像度假

translation.en: Hardworking holiday, it was.
[narrator] In fact, Hitler is far from ready
translation.zh: ‎事实上希特勒根本没有准备好

translation.en: to fight the combined British and French armies.
It takes his army over 20 days to defeat the Poles.
translation.zh: ‎他花了二十天才打败波兰人

translation.en: Polish resistance has given Hitler's armed forces
translation.zh: ‎波兰人的抵抗给希特勒军队带来重创

translation.en: a major battering, and they have lost a substantial number
translation.zh: ‎波兰人的抵抗给希特勒军队带来重创 ‎他们损失了大量的

translation.en: of their armored vehicles.
[in German] It becomes evident that Germany isn't equipped for this war.
translation.zh: ‎显然德国人装备上没有做好准备

translation.en: The German forces do have tanks and tank divisions,
but they only account for a small part of the Wehrmacht.
translation.zh: ‎但只占到纳粹德军的小部分

translation.en: We have not well-trained soldiers, we have no supply, no ammunition, whatever.
translation.zh:
‎我们没有训练有素的士兵 没有供给
‎没有军火 什么也没有

translation.en: Poland was the proof that we possibly are not able
to fight against a proper army, and France is a proper army.
translation.zh:
‎对抗像样的部队
‎而法军正式一支这样的部队…

translation.en: France is the best-trained, best-equipped army in Europe.
translation.zh:
‎法军在欧洲是一支
‎训练有素装备精良的部队

translation.en: How can we, as Germans, win?
No way. We're going to lose.
[in German] In reality, the Wehrmacht is an army
that will become very dependent on horses for transportation
and their whole logistics.
Only about ten percent of the German divisions are motorized.
translation.zh: ‎只有百分之十的德军是机动车队

translation.en: [narrator] The French Army has a formidable artillery
and over 3,000 tanks on the northeast front,
800 more than the Germans.
Despite facing a weakened German Army
and holding an overwhelming military advantage,
translation.zh: ‎盟军有拥有强大的军事优势

translation.en: the Allies choose to dig in, not to attack.
translation.zh: ‎但盟军选择了驻扎而不是进攻

translation.en: What you then get, after the outbreak of war in 1939,
is this long period known as the Phoney War
in which the Germans are deciding what to do next
and the Allies are waiting.
One of the reasons the Allies were acting on the defensive
is because the French had built this huge defensive system,
translation.zh: ‎就是法军在打造强大的防御系统

translation.en: the Maginot Line, on the Franco-German border
to prevent the sort of bloodshed that had happened in the First World War.
[narrator] While the Allies wait, Hitler assesses how to respond.
translation.zh:
‎在盟军等待的同事
‎希特勒评估该如何反应

translation.en: His sights had been set on the east.
Now, he had to deal with an unexpected threat from the west.
translation.zh: ‎他得应对西面出其不意的威胁

translation.en: Hermann Göring leads the generals in a campaign
to convince him not to start a war with France,
translation.zh: ‎说服希特勒不要与法国开战

translation.en: so they present him with a plan destined to fail.
translation.zh: ‎他们给他一个注定会失败的计划

translation.en: All the generals were against it.
They said "No, don't negotiate. Do something,
translation.zh: ‎他们说“不 不要协商 做点什么

translation.en: but we can't solve that problem
with military means."
And then they presented a rather boring war plan to Hitler,
translation.zh:
‎最后他们给希特勒
‎一个相当枯燥的战斗计划

translation.en: and Hitler said, you know, "Look, what's that?
I mean, that's the same thing as 1914.
Where are new ideas? Where are fresh ideas?
translation.zh:
‎新的想法在哪里？
‎新的思路呢？

translation.en: Uh... This is not going to work."
German military leadership doesn't want to have that war.
translation.zh: ‎德军领导层不希望打那场战

translation.en: Their vision, in the end of 1939,
Hitler is pushing for an attack on France,
and their perception is, "We're going to lose."
I mean, look, in the First World War, we fought four years against France
translation.zh: ‎看 在一战中我们和法国打了四年

translation.en: with a huge army, a much better-trained army, and we lost.
translation.zh:
‎当时的部队人多训练更好
‎但我们输了

translation.en: [narrator] The original plan drawn up by Hitler's conservative generals
translation.zh: ‎希特勒保守的将领最初的计划

translation.en: follows the playbook from the First World War,
to invade Holland and Belgium from the north
as well as Northern France.
It is a plan that plays to the strength of the Allies,
deliberately designed to end in disaster.
[Sonke] How can you persuade a dictator not to do it?
translation.zh: ‎一个独裁者怎么可能被说服？

translation.en: You can't say, you know, "You're an idiot and you have to negotiate."
translation.zh: ‎你不能说“你是个白痴 你得协商”

translation.en: But if you...
translation.zh: ‎但如果你从军事的角度劝他

translation.en: persuade him from a military side, "It's not possible,
translation.zh: ‎但如果你从军事的角度劝他 ‎“这行不通 我们会输的”

translation.en: we're going to lose,"
that was, in the end, somehow the plan.
translation.zh: ‎在某种程度上计划本身就是

translation.en: Don't offer him a plan which might work.
[narrator] But one ambitious general,
the Prussian aristocrat Erich von Manstein, falls out of step.
translation.zh:
‎普鲁士贵族埃希里•凡•曼斯泰因
‎有别的想法

translation.en: He suggests a plan with a far greater chance of success.
translation.zh: ‎他提出一个成功率高得多的计划

translation.en: The conservative generals move quickly to shut him down.
translation.zh: ‎保守将领们希望尽快制止他

translation.en: Manstein feels very strongly that they will be able to take advantage
translation.zh: ‎曼斯泰因强烈认为他们能够利用

translation.en: of the sort of disorienting effects of driving quickly into the French lines.
translation.zh: ‎迷惑敌人快速突破法军防线

translation.en: By attacking them much faster than they expect,
they'll be able to push the French back
and completely disorganize their command arrangements.
And sow so much confusion that they'll be able to make great progress,
translation.zh: ‎让他们困惑不已 能取得巨大进展

translation.en: and the infantry will follow, and they'll literally rip
the French Army apart from the inside.
[narrator] With Manstein's plan shelved, Hitler makes use of the Phoney War
translation.zh:
‎曼斯泰因的计划被搁置
‎希特勒采用“奇怪战斗”

translation.en: to secure a supply of iron ore for weapons.
His forces invade Denmark and Southern Norway.
translation.zh: ‎他的部队入侵丹麦和挪威南部

translation.en: The British spot the danger.
[Saul] Germany, to secure its northern flank
and its route out of the Baltic,
decided to invade Norway and Denmark
on 9th of April 1940.
And the British in particular responded
by trying to land troops in Norway.
It's gonna give a lot of valuable resources,
translation.zh: ‎这里将给德国人带来宝贵的资源

translation.en: iron ore and other resources in Norway to the Germans,
and they need to forestall this.
[narrator] Ill-prepared to respond to the attack,
the Allies land troops in Norway,
but their operation is half-hearted and incompetent.
The Germans deploy their powerful new force,
translation.zh: ‎德国全力部署了强大的新武装

translation.en: the Luftwaffe, to great effect.
Its Stuka dive bombers wreak havoc with the Allied forces.
translation.zh:
‎斯塔克式俯冲轰炸机
‎给盟军造成巨大伤亡

translation.en: It's a kind of terrible humiliation for the Western Allies,
and by the beginning of May 1940,
all Allied troops have left Norway, and it's firmly in German hands.
translation.zh:
‎所有盟军部队离开挪威
‎德国牢牢掌握了挪威

translation.en: [narrator] Meanwhile, the persistent General Manstein
finds a moment to unveil his plan to Hitler.
translation.zh: ‎找到机会让希特勒了解他的计划

translation.en: He knows he will only get one chance.
translation.zh: ‎曼斯泰因知道只有一次机会

translation.en: Manstein sees an opportunity to change Hitler's mind,
and so he says, "Look, we need to do something different.
translation.zh:
‎所以他说
‎“听着 我们只需要做点不一样的事

translation.en: Let's do this, let's take full advantage
of our Panzer divisions and the Luftwaffe,
and let's use the element of surprise. Do something they will never expect."
translation.zh: ‎出其不意 让他们始料未及”

translation.en: And so, Hitler endorses his plan. It seems much bolder.
translation.zh:
‎希特勒批准了计划
‎计划看起来更大胆

translation.en: It seems much more likely to bring a rapid success
than the more ponderous plan agreed upon by his general staff.
translation.zh: ‎对比将领们同意的笨拙计划

translation.en: [narrator] On the tenth of May, the British Prime Minister,
Neville Chamberlain, is forced to resign over the Norway debacle.
translation.zh: ‎内维•张伯伦因为挪威沦陷被迫下台

translation.en: He is replaced by Winston Churchill.
Churchill's a maverick, he's got a checkered political career,
translation.zh:
‎丘吉尔是个离经叛道的人
‎他的政治生涯可圈可点

translation.en: but he was the one, right the way through the 1930s,
translation.zh: ‎但在整个二十世纪三十年代

translation.en: who was insisting that we shouldn't appease Hitler.
translation.zh: ‎他是坚持不该安抚希特勒的人

translation.en: We needed to stand up against him.
And now, finally, Churchill is given his chance to lead the British in war.
translation.zh: ‎现在丘吉尔终于有机会指挥英军

translation.en: [narrator] In his first speech to the House of Commons,
translation.zh: ‎在对众议院发表的首次讲话中

translation.en: the new premier announces...
[Churchill] I would say to the House
as I had said to those who joined the government...
translation.zh: ‎正如我对政府工作人员说的

translation.en: I have nothing to offer but blood,
toil, tears and sweat.
[narrator] On the day Churchill becomes prime minister,
Germany launches a devastating attack on Belgium and Holland.
translation.zh: ‎德国对比利时和荷兰发动致命打击

translation.en: German parachutists capture strategic bridges in Holland.
translation.zh: ‎德国伞兵占领了荷兰的战略性桥

translation.en: [narrator] The Luftwaffe bombs airfields.
The airborne troops drop to overwhelm its tiny neighbors.
translation.zh: ‎空军对这个小邻国投放大量炸弹

translation.en: It seems clear that Hitler intends to grab the Channel ports
translation.zh: ‎明显希特勒旨在控制英吉利海峡港口

translation.en: and acquire bases from which he could eventually invade Great Britain.
translation.zh: ‎获得可以最终入侵大英帝国的基地

translation.en: They have to seize those Channel ports, because otherwise,
the German Navy is in a backwater.
They're in the North Sea and the Baltic, and they can't get out.
translation.zh:
‎他们位于北海和波罗的海
‎无法出来

translation.en: Whereas if they can get those Channel ports
translation.zh: ‎而如果他们能掌控这些港口

translation.en: and they can get the French Atlantic ports,
they can then have access to the open seas.
[narrator] The Allies are well prepared for this move and respond quickly,
translation.zh: ‎盟军对此有所准备并迅速回应

translation.en: pushing their best forces into Belgium to meet the attack.
translation.zh: ‎在比利时部署最好的军队迎接攻击

translation.en: At this point, reconnaissance planes send back confusing news from the south.
translation.zh:
‎此时 侦察机从南方发回
‎令人迷惑的消息

translation.en: They report a huge military traffic jam along the road to the Ardennes,
translation.zh: ‎他们报告在阿登高地有许多军事车辆

translation.en: stretching all the way back across the German border.
[James] The problem is, is the French refuse to believe
what they're being reported by reconnaissance pilots.
General Gamelin, commander in chief of all French forces,
translation.zh: ‎加默兰将军 法军总指挥说

translation.en: said, "That's impossible. That can't be true."
And so, it was ignored.
[narrator] It was a terrible mistake as Manstein's master plan unfolds.
translation.zh:
‎这是个可怕的错误
‎随着曼斯泰恩的计划展开

translation.en: The reconnaissance was correct.
The Germans had been amassing in the Ardennes, and now,
translation.zh: ‎德鲁大量部队在阿登高地 而现在

translation.en: they plunge through the woods and thunder across the River Meuse
translation.zh: ‎他们穿过森林 轰隆隆渡过默兹河

translation.en: on the French border.
[Geoffrey] The French are gonna have just a skeleton force
translation.zh: ‎法军在阿登高地意外默兹河畔

translation.en: on the Meuse beyond the Ardennes, because they're never gonna expect us
translation.zh:
‎只有一支空壳子部队
‎因为他们没料到

translation.en: to come through here.
[narrator] The invasions of Holland and Belgium
were designed to lure the Allies north.
[Saul] They want to draw the cream of the Allied armies
translation.zh: ‎他们希望调走盟军的精英部队

translation.en: in Northern France into Belgium, and also into Southern Holland,
translation.zh: ‎从法国北部进入比利时和荷兰南部

translation.en: so that the actual attack through the Ardennes
translation.zh: ‎如此一来 在阿登高地发动真正进攻

translation.en: can come through behind them and cut them off.
[Sonke] This is our cunning plan. We are going to encircle them in Belgium.
translation.zh:
‎这是我们狡猾的计划
‎我们要把他们包围在比利时

translation.en: We also secretly attack in the Ardennes, in this difficult area.
translation.zh:
‎我们也在秘密袭击阿登地区
‎这个困难的地区

translation.en: We will be crossing the Meuse and then dashing through the Channel
translation.zh:
‎我们会跨过默兹河
‎然后迅速进入英吉利海峡

translation.en: and encircling the British Expeditionary Force
and the French Army in Belgium.
We have to take the Allies by surprise.
This is always a major aspect of winning a war: surprise your enemies.
translation.zh: ‎这永远是取得战斗胜利的主要方面 ‎攻其不备

translation.en: [narrator] The operation will also use time, speed and daring
translation.zh: ‎行动也需要时间、速度和胆量

translation.en: to make up for the inferiority of the German military.
[Geoffrey] It uses all of these modern technologies.
It promises a quick victory.
And it suggests that he might not only defeat the French Army,
translation.zh: ‎计划也显示可能不仅能打败法军

translation.en: but annihilate the entire British Army.
[narrator] The new British prime minister, Churchill,
translation.zh: ‎英国新首相丘吉尔陷入噩梦

translation.en: has been plunged into a nightmare as German tanks rampaged
towards the French border city of Sedan.
[narrator] Had the French taken their own reconnaissance seriously,
translation.zh: ‎如果法军认真对待侦察机的情报

translation.en: they would've had the German Army at their mercy.
The military bottleneck had left the German artillery
incredibly vulnerable.
[James] It turns into the biggest gridlock in the history of gridlocks.
translation.zh: ‎结果这成为历史上最大的僵局

translation.en: Now, a French reconnaissance plane flies over and sees this.
Now, at that point, it would've been perfectly possible
to organize every single French and British bomber available
translation.zh: ‎组织起所有可用的英法轰炸机

translation.en: and go and bomb it.
It would've stopped the German advance in its tracks, that would've been
translation.zh: ‎这本可用阻止德国前进的步伐

translation.en: the end of the. war and the whole thing would've been avoided. I mean,
translation.zh:
‎本可用终结战斗
‎整件事都能避免

translation.en: it makes me so cross every time I think about it.
translation.zh: ‎每次想到这些我都非常生气

translation.en: I mean, it was just such a missed opportunity.
[narrator] The Germans push home their advantage
with an astonishing display of speed.
Before the French can react, they charge towards the French border town, Sedan.
translation.zh:
‎在法军能有所反应之前
‎他们成功来到边境城市赛丹

translation.en: Infantry, tanks, and artillery show incredible levels of stamina,
outrunning the enemy defense forces.
Barely stopping, they reach Sedan in three days.
translation.zh:
‎几乎马不停蹄地
‎他们三天内就到达了赛丹

translation.en: Many German soldiers haven't slept since the start of the campaign.
translation.zh: ‎从行进开始大多数德国士兵就不睡觉

translation.en: The French can't quite believe it.
The German tanks roll into Sedan without opposition.
translation.zh: ‎德国坦克如入无人之境踏平了赛丹

translation.en: The French defenses are unexpectedly confronted
translation.zh: ‎法国防守部队遇到意外袭击

translation.en: by 60,000 rampaging Germans
in 22,000 vehicles and 850 tanks.
translation.zh: ‎两万两千两装甲车和八百五十辆坦克

translation.en: After three days on the march,
the Germans have no intention of stopping.
translation.zh: ‎德国人丝毫没有停下来的意思

translation.en: They prepare to cross the River Meuse in three places.
translation.zh: ‎他们准备从三处横渡默兹河

translation.en: The plan is a textbook example of Bewegungskrieg.
translation.zh: ‎这一计划是运动战的典型教材

translation.en: a warfare maneuver the Germans are already well-known for.
The architect is Heinz Guderian,
a general who knows how to combine new technology
translation.zh: ‎这位将军知道如何整合新科技

translation.en: with the traditional German approach to warfare,
attacking the enemy with overwhelming force
and encircling them before they can react.
translation.zh: ‎在敌人反应过来之前将其包围

translation.en: [James] What Guderian is very good at doing
is harnessing new methods, the Luftwaffe as aerial artillery;
translation.zh: ‎利用新办法 空军作为空中火力

translation.en: new mobile equipment, trucks, mobile artillery,
translation.zh: ‎新移动设备、坦克和机动火力

translation.en: and of course, panzers, tanks, but also radio technology, too.
translation.zh: ‎当然还有装甲车、坦克和无线电

translation.en: [narrator] French Commander General Maurice Gamelin
orders that Sedan must be defended at all costs,
translation.zh: ‎命令赛丹不惜一切代价抵抗

translation.en: but he has prepared his troops for a repeat of the grinding attrition
of the First World War.
When they're suddenly confronted by the need to be mobile,
translation.zh: ‎当他们突然需要机动作战时

translation.en: they don't know what to do.
[narrator] No one expects the nightmare about to unfold.
Wave after wave of dive bombers pummel the French defensive positions.
translation.zh: ‎俯冲轰炸机一波波冲击着法国的防线

translation.en: Hardly a single bunker suffers a direct hit,
translation.zh: ‎几乎没有碉堡遇到直接打击

translation.en: and only 56 casualties are taken, but the psychological effect
translation.zh: ‎伤亡只有五十六人 ‎但这种心理打击是毁灭性的

translation.en: of the screaming bombers and the whistling bombs is devastating.
translation.zh:
‎轰炸机呼啸而过
‎炸弹不断落下

translation.en: [in German] These German attacks
were an absolute catastrophe for the French defenders.
It becomes evident rather quickly
that the French morale is broken by these attacks
and the French do not manage to organize proper counterattacks.
translation.zh: ‎法国人无法组织有效的反击

translation.en: I can only conclude that this is a legacy of the First World War,
translation.zh: ‎我只能说这是一战的后遗症

translation.en: those four long, brutal years of fighting in which enormous quantities
of Frenchmen have died, and there's a feeling among Frenchmen,
translation.zh: ‎巨大的法国伤亡 法国人有种感觉

translation.en: just a generation later, that they don't want to go through it again.
translation.zh: ‎就在一代人后 他们不想再次经历

translation.en: [narrator] In the confusion, German infantry flood across the Meuse.
translation.zh: ‎趁着法军的困惑德军步兵渡过默兹河

translation.en: It's a dangerous move.
The German forces are isolated and open to counterattack.
translation.zh: ‎德国部队被隔开 容易受到反击

translation.en: [Saul] By the evening of the 13th of May, although a certain number of Germans
translation.zh:
‎到五月十三日夜晚
‎虽然德军有一定伤亡

translation.en: have got across the river, they are very vulnerable.
translation.zh: ‎但成功渡河 他们非常脆弱

translation.en: No tanks have actually got across at this point,
and this is an opportunity for the French to actually counterattack.
[narrator] But, shell-shocked, the French tank drivers
translation.zh: ‎但患上炮弹休克症的法国坦克驾驶员

translation.en: are slow to react.
[Saul] By the time they finally sorted themselves out
and the attack is put in on the 14th,
Guderian's got enough armor over the river on pontoon bridges built by his pioneers
translation.zh:
‎古德里安在先遣队搭的桥上
‎部署了足够武力

translation.en: to actually knock out those French tanks.
[James] What they don't have is any kind of tactical nous whatsoever.
The biggest failure of all for the French is that
they haven't thought about communications at all.
So General Gamelin, who is the commander in chief
of all French forces, is at the Chateau de Vincennes
just on the edge of Paris, and he doesn't even have a telephone
translation.zh: ‎位于巴黎郊外 但他连电话都没有

translation.en: because he thinks it will be a security risk.
translation.zh: ‎因为他认为这是个安全风险

translation.en: I mean, it's just insane.
[narrator] The French are dependent on field telephone lines,
which get cut by Stukas, and on dispatch riders
translation.zh:
‎电话线被斯卡图式轰炸机毁掉
‎而摩托车通信员

translation.en: who take ages to get messages through
translation.zh: ‎要花费很长时间来传递消息

translation.en: because the roads are clogged with refugees.
[narrator] The French believed it would take the Germans two weeks
translation.zh: ‎法国人以为德国人需要两周

translation.en: to reach Sedan.
Not three days.
In three days and nights,
the fearless, relentless onslaught never stopped.
The soldiers performed like supermen.
It became increasingly clear that this German army
was unlike anything seen before.
What the French didn't know is that the German army
translation.zh: ‎而法国人不知道的是德国军队

translation.en: had a secret weapon.
The weapon was manufactured by the Berlin drug company called Temmler.
translation.zh: ‎武器由柏林一家叫特姆勒的药厂生产

translation.en: Pervitin is a powerful methamphetamine
translation.zh: ‎脱氧麻黄碱是强力甲基苯丙胺

translation.en: known on the streets today as crystal meth.
Already sold as an over-the-counter pick-me-up in Germany,
translation.zh: ‎在德国作为自选非处方药销售

translation.en: the drug proves invaluable in the theater of war.
translation.zh: ‎该药物在战争中起到宝贵作用

translation.en: [in German] Pervitin is seen as the ideal drug to combat fatigue.
translation.zh: ‎脱氧麻黄碱是抗疲劳理想药物

translation.en: In the Second World War, it is used especially for the Panzer troops
translation.zh: ‎在二战中 专供给装甲车部队

translation.en: and the night fighters.
Troops that are always close to the enemy
and have to remain active for a long time.
[Geoffrey] Pervitin had been used by German civilians, you know.
They'd get it in a pharmacy, and it would be used to be alert
translation.zh:
‎他们去药房买
‎可以用来保持清醒

translation.en: and stay awake and get a lot of stuff done.
And as the war drags on, you'd start seeing Pervitin
translation.zh:
‎随着战争的持续
‎脱氧麻黄碱

translation.en: being issued to German troops and airmen like candy.
translation.zh: ‎像糖果一样配给德国陆军和空军

translation.en: [narrator] Methamphetamine can dull feelings of empathy
translation.zh: ‎甲基苯丙胺能麻木人的同情心

translation.en: and make you feel superhuman,
the very qualities needed to create a near-perfect soldier.
translation.zh: ‎这是完美士兵所需要的素质

translation.en: [Norman] There are many reports that just before the attacks
translation.zh:
‎在一九四零年五月十日战斗开始前
‎有许多报告表明

translation.en: started on May 10th, 1940, there were a lot of soldiers
translation.zh:
‎在一九四零年五月十日战斗开始前
‎有许多报告表明 ‎士兵抑郁了 产生厌战情绪…

translation.en: who were depressed, who didn't want to fight,
translation.zh: ‎士兵抑郁了 产生厌战情绪…

translation.en: who remembered the First World War.
So the morale of the Germans was quite low,
but once you take methamphetamine,
your morale actually becomes quite high.
[narrator] The German tactic of Blitzkrieg
relied on overwhelming air superiority, super-fast tanks,
translation.zh: ‎高度依靠制空权 快速行进的坦克

translation.en: up-to-the-minute communications, and a tireless and fearless militia.
translation.zh: ‎及时通信和不知疲惫无所畏惧的战士

translation.en: [Norman] For the first time in military history,
an army did not have to rest at night,
but could go on for three days and three nights.
So without Pervitin, this obviously wouldn't have worked.
translation.zh:
‎所以没有甲基麻黄碱
‎这显然不可能

translation.en: [Norman] It really helps a person to become a fighting robot.
Imagine this on the scale of a couple of hundred thousand people,
translation.zh: ‎想象这发生在几十万士兵身上

translation.en: heavily armed, storming into enemy territory.
translation.zh: ‎高度武装 快速进入敌军领地

translation.en: It just becomes a completely crazy situation.
The side effects of Pervitin is that it does make you a little bit reckless.
translation.zh: ‎甲基麻黄碱的副作用会让人变得残酷

translation.en: It gives you what's-- You know, Dutch courage.
On the 13th of May, when they're crossing the River Meuse--
translation.zh: ‎五月十三日 当他们渡过默兹河

translation.en: Because these guys have just got to keep going.
The fighting goes on until dusk and beyond.
How do you keep them going? Well, you know, popping a Pervitin tablet,
translation.zh:
‎如何让他们继续？
‎吃一片甲基麻黄碱

translation.en: just on that one occasion, is possibly not a bad idea.
translation.zh: ‎只有在那种时候 这或许是个好主意

translation.en: I mean, it's better to suffer the aftereffects of Pervitin than be dead.
[narrator] To the north, the decoy assault is gathering pace.
translation.zh: ‎在北方引诱攻击在快速展开

translation.en: The Germans bombard the Port of Rotterdam,
killing around 1,000 people.
So shocked are the Dutch by the number of casualties
and the gutting of the center of Rotterdam
that it actually encourages them to give up.
So already, in just four days, the Dutch are knocked out of the fight.
translation.zh: ‎所以四天后荷兰人就被打败了

translation.en: [narrator] With the French defenses smashed at Sedan,
translation.zh: ‎随着法国防守在赛丹被击溃

translation.en: Guderian is ordered to halt his advance and wait for the infantry to catch up.
translation.zh:
‎古德里安接到命令停止前进
‎等待步兵赶上

translation.en: He ignores them.
Flanked by his officers on motorcycles, he charges out in front of his tanks
translation.zh:
‎在摩托车军官的护送下
‎他坐着坦克

translation.en: through the French countryside.
[James] Guderian is very dynamic. He's smart, he's well read,
translation.zh:
‎古德里安非常富有活力
‎聪明博览群书

translation.en: he's hugely experienced,
and he's not afraid of trying new things.
And he's not one who's shy of making decisions either.
Do I just ignore my superior officers' orders
translation.zh: ‎是忽视上级的命令继续前进

translation.en: and go for it, and potentially win Germany
this amazing victory,
or do I hold fire and wait for the infantry just to catch up,
thereby potentially losing momentum and all the rest of it?
translation.zh: ‎因此失去宝贵的时机和胜利？

translation.en: And he thinks, "To hell with it. I'm gonna go for it."
translation.zh: ‎他想“见鬼去吧 我要继续”

translation.en: [narrator] The prime minister of France, Paul Reynaud,
is shocked by the speed of the German advance.
translation.zh: ‎对德军挺近的速度大吃一惊

translation.en: He calls Britain's new prime minister with terrible news.
translation.zh: ‎他电话告知英国新首相这一可怕消息

translation.en: [Saul] Reynaud, you could tell, was in a terrible panic.
translation.zh: ‎你可以想象 雷诺惊慌失措

translation.en: He contacts Churchill, he speaks to him on the telephone,
translation.zh: ‎联系上丘吉尔 电话上告诉他

translation.en: and he basically says the battle is lost.
Already, in just five days, "I think the battle is lost.
The Germans have broken through in such numbers
that I don't think we can stop them."
[narrator] The Germans are closing in on the French capital,
and Churchill fears that the French are unable to respond quickly enough
to mount the rapid counterattack that is needed.
[Sonke] Churchill saw that everything was collapsing,
and that very moment, it was important
that the French are continuing to fight
and reacting and fighting and fighting and fighting,
translation.zh: ‎回应和战斗 战斗 再战斗

translation.en: and counter-offensives, and again and again,
and not being in this totally mental breakdown.
[narrator] On the 16th of May, just six days after taking office,
translation.zh: ‎五月十六日 任职六天后

translation.en: Churchill flies to Paris to try and stiffen French resolve.
translation.zh: ‎丘吉尔飞到巴黎试图强化法国的决心

translation.en: [Saul] What he's determined to do
is to somehow keep the French in the fight,
because if the French fall out, it's Britain alone.
translation.zh:
‎因为如果法国退出
‎英国就孤立无援了

translation.en: [narrator] On the 20th of May 1940,
just ten days after setting out from the German border,
Guderian's decision to ignore his superiors is vindicated
translation.zh:
‎古德里安忽略命令的决定
‎被证明是正确的

translation.en: as he reaches the Atlantic Coast.
Well, that actually takes quite a bit of courage to make a decision like that,
translation.zh: ‎做那样的决定需要很大的勇气

translation.en: you know, because if you get it wrong and it's not a success
and it ends in defeat, you're in big, big trouble,
translation.zh: ‎以失败告终 你就惹了大麻烦

translation.en: particularly in a totalitarian militaristic state like Nazi Germany.
translation.zh: ‎特别在纳粹德国这样的独裁军事国家

translation.en: But, you know, he has the courage of his convictions, and he goes for it.
translation.zh:
‎但他对自己的想法有信心
‎所以继续了

translation.en: And of course, it's absolutely extraordinary, unprecedented in history.
translation.zh: ‎当然这在历史上完全是绝无仅有的

translation.en: [narrator] Hitler's great gamble on Manstein's plan has paid off.
translation.zh:
‎希特勒最大的赌博是
‎曼斯坦因的计划会成功

translation.en: The bulk of the Allied forces are now trapped in narrow corridor.
translation.zh: ‎大量盟军如今被困一个狭窄的走廊

translation.en: [Saul] It means that those Allied armies further north,
including the whole of the British Expeditionary Force,
have been cut off from their lines of supply.
So, those troops in Belgium
who are surrounded, of course, on all sides now by Germans
who are fighting also in Belgium and also in Holland,
translation.zh: ‎在比利时和荷兰作战的部队

translation.en: are completely surrounded by German forces,
and their only way out is either by cutting through them
translation.zh: ‎他们逃脱的办法要么是穿过德军势力

translation.en: or being rescued from the Channel coast.
[narrator] It will take Guderian no more than a few days
to block off that last escape route to the coast,
and thus encircle a million Allied soldiers.
translation.zh: ‎所以包围了一百万盟军士兵

translation.en: Having become trapped in his pocket, the British start to make plans
translation.zh:
‎在四面围困的情况下
‎英国人开始制定计划

translation.en: to evacuate their troops by sea, and Churchill settles on Calais
translation.zh: ‎从海上营救士兵 ‎丘吉尔认为加来

translation.en: as the best place to bring in large ships.
So, he sends three elite British regiments to hold it,
translation.zh: ‎因为派出三支英国精英部队守住加来

translation.en: and they're all sacrificed; the Germans annihilate them,
translation.zh: ‎他们全部牺牲 被德军歼灭

translation.en: and they lose Calais.
[narrator] The loss of life is daunting, but the distraction
translation.zh:
‎死亡人数非常惊人
‎但这争取了时间

translation.en: buys the BEF time to make other plans.
translation.zh: ‎让英国海外派遣军制定其他计划

translation.en: The decision to send the troops to Calais is actually a key bit of the story,
translation.zh: ‎决定派军去加来其实是故事的关键

translation.en: because without that blocking force,
which was ultimately captured by the Germans,
the rest of the BEF and the French armies fighting alongside it
translation.zh:
‎余下的海外派遣军和
‎法国部队与之并肩作战

translation.en: are not gonna have enough time to get to the coast at Dunkirk
translation.zh: ‎是没有足够时间到达敦刻尔克海岸

translation.en: to construct a defensive perimeter that will allow them to be rescued.
[narrator] Just as it seems that hundreds of thousands
of Allied soldiers are within hours of being slaughtered or captured,
translation.zh: ‎盟军士兵几小时内会被杀死或者俘虏

translation.en: Hitler makes a highly controversial decision.
translation.zh: ‎希特勒做了个非常有争议的决定

translation.en: [in German] When the German forces have almost
driven the Allies back to the Channel harbors,
translation.zh: ‎将盟军赶到英吉利海峡港口时

translation.en: Hitler suddenly orders them to stop.
translation.zh: ‎希特勒突然让他们停止前进

translation.en: The German tank officers thought,
"I mean, are they crazy? Are they mad? We are going to win.
translation.zh: ‎“他们是疯了吗？我们就要赢了

translation.en: Yes, we are exhausted, yes, we are short of supplies but...
translation.zh: ‎是啊 我们精疲力尽 补给不足

translation.en: speed is our lifeline.
Stopping is not an option."
But then they got the clear order,
so yes, they stopped and they were asking themselves,
translation.zh:
‎所以 是的 他们停下来了
‎他们问自己

translation.en: "What the hell's going on here? That's ridiculous."
[in German] One of the reasons was surely that the Generals
translation.zh: ‎其中一原因肯定他们的将军

translation.en: had acted independently in the days prior and flouted Hitler's authority.
translation.zh: ‎在前几日无视希特勒的权威

translation.en: Hitler wanted to show that he was the supreme war commander
translation.zh: ‎希特勒希望他们知道谁才是指挥

translation.en: and they had to obey him.
[narrator] The man behind the decision
is Luftwaffe Commander in Chief Hermann Göring.
He convinces Hitler that the honor of annihilating the Allied soldiers
translation.zh: ‎他说服希特勒歼灭盟军的荣誉

translation.en: should fall not to the German Army, but to the Nazi-dominated air force.
translation.zh: ‎不属于德国陆军而应属于空军

translation.en: [Geoffrey] Hermann Göring was a very influential Nazi,
translation.zh: ‎赫尔曼•戈林是非常有影响力的纳粹

translation.en: and he'd been touting the Luftwaffe as the arm, the weapon of the future.
translation.zh: ‎他一直鼓吹空军是未来战争的臂膀

translation.en: And he was like, "Look, let me unleash the Luftwaffe.
translation.zh: ‎他说“听着 我能发挥空军作用

translation.en: These are sitting ducks on the beach, I can destroy them from the air
translation.zh:
‎这些人坐在海滩上
‎我能从空军摧毁他们

translation.en: and you can use the army, you can move south and destroy
the rest of the French army, take Paris and pursue them
translation.zh: ‎剩下的法军 占领巴黎 劝他们

translation.en: across the Loire if that's the direction they take.
translation.zh:
‎渡过卢瓦尔河
‎如果法军走那个方向

translation.en: And the Luftwaffe can do this, you know, without wasting the field army."
translation.zh: ‎空军可以做到 不用浪费陆军”

translation.en: [in German] Back when they took this weapon from the Germans in Versailles,
translation.zh: ‎当他们在凡尔赛夺走德国的空军…

translation.en: they did not expect Germany to rebuild this weapon,
translation.zh: ‎…没想到德国还能再次打造起空军

translation.en: stronger and more powerful, under Adolf Hitler's leadership.
translation.zh: ‎在阿道夫•希特勒领导下更强大

translation.en: [narrator] But Göring's plan soon starts to unravel.
translation.zh: ‎但戈林的计划很快就失败了

translation.en: Very conveniently for the British, there was ten tenths' cloud cover
translation.zh:
‎对英国人来说非常有利
‎连续十日阴云密布

translation.en: for most of the evacuation period, which is made worse by the fact
translation.zh:
‎撤退期间的大部分时间
‎对德军更不利的是

translation.en: that the Germans have already bombed the oil refinery at Dunkirk,
translation.zh: ‎德国人已经轰炸了敦刻尔克的炼油厂

translation.en: and vast clouds of black smoke are pitching 15,000 feet into the sky.
translation.zh: ‎大量黑烟上升到空中一万五千英尺

translation.en: So basically, you can't actually see anything.
[narrator] The poor visibility makes it very difficult
translation.zh: ‎糟糕的能见度使得空军轰炸

translation.en: for the Luftwaffe to dive bomb,
and even when the clouds start to disperse,
the Stukas struggle to hit their targets.
translation.zh: ‎斯图卡式轰炸机很难击中目标

translation.en: From 6,000 feet when you're starting your dive bombing,
translation.zh: ‎从六千英尺的高空投放炸弹

translation.en: a destroyer crammed full of men just looks like a pencil
translation.zh: ‎载满人的驱逐舰就像一根铅笔那么小

translation.en: and it's kind of wobbling around all over the place,
and it's incredibly difficult to hit something that has been moving
from that distance.
[narrator] Göring's planes also find themselves facing an unexpected weapon.
translation.zh: ‎戈林的飞机面临一个未料到的敌人

translation.en: Among the squadrons sent to defend the evacuation
by the RAF's fighter command in the south of England
translation.zh: ‎在南英指挥皇家空军的战斗机

translation.en: is a brilliant new fighter plane:
the Supermarine Spitfire.
For the first time, the fighter command
was able to break the German air superiority.
They're sending Spitfires and Hurricanes from Southeast England over to Dunkirk
translation.zh:
‎从东南部派去敦刻尔克的
‎喷火战斗机和飓风战斗机

translation.en: to cover the evacuation and actually, they do a pretty good job.
translation.zh: ‎掩护撤退 他们很好地完成了任务

translation.en: They suffer as well, but they're pretty effective
and they shoot down dive bombers-- German dive bombers in their droves.
translation.zh:
‎他们打下俯冲轰炸机
‎一群群的德国轰炸机

translation.en: [narrator] The Luftwaffe bombs a number of Royal Navy ships,
translation.zh: ‎德国空军轰炸一些皇家海军的船

translation.en: but it fails to annihilate the British and French forces on the beaches
translation.zh: ‎但没能在海滩上歼灭英军和法军

translation.en: or their rescue boats as Göring had hoped.
translation.zh:
‎也不如戈林希望那样
‎打到他们的救生船

translation.en: Royal Engineers Private Cecil Ingram recalls the evacuation.
translation.zh:
‎皇家工兵部队列兵塞西尔英格拉姆
‎回忆撤退

translation.en: [Cecil] It was a mass of soldiers...
and we were being dive-bombed the whole time,
so you were trying to make yourself as safe as possible by sort of,
burying into the sand as far as you could go.
You were lying low.
You could hear and see these Stuka bombers coming down
translation.zh: ‎你能听到和看到轰炸机俯冲下来

translation.en: and the horrendous noise as they revved up and dived down.
translation.zh: ‎它们加速和俯冲的可怕噪音

translation.en: To be honest, I was quite scared...
because you didn't know what was happening.
It was... You know, communications had completely broken down.
I think the word to use, it was "chaotic".
So, I eventually got up, walked into the water
with my rifle aloft, very wet.
translation.zh: ‎把来复枪举起来 浑身湿透

translation.en: I managed to get onto a naval ship.
My feet were bleeding.
I spent the journey over to England lying on the deck of this ship.
translation.zh: ‎回到英国的路上我都躺在甲板上

translation.en: [narrator] Royal Army Service Corps Private Stanley William Priest
translation.zh:
‎皇家空军一等兵斯
‎坦利•威廉•普利司特

translation.en: survived a German air attack over the Channel.
translation.zh: ‎在德军的空袭中通过英吉利海峡生还

translation.en: [Stanley] We entered Dunkirk during an air raid
translation.zh: ‎我们在空袭中进入敦刻尔克

translation.en: and there were several severe air raids. A direct hit would have killed 100.
translation.zh:
‎有几次空袭
‎每次直接打击都能杀死一百人…

translation.en: And we saw some planes approaching, and they machine-gunned the boat,
translation.zh: ‎我们看到飞机逼近和船上的机枪

translation.en: killing 60 or so and wounding many others, including myself.
translation.zh:
‎杀死六十多人
‎很多人受伤包括我自己

translation.en: I took shelter in a little alcove.
The bullets were passing an inch or two from my feet,
so had I been on deck, I'd almost certainly have been killed, or--
translation.zh: ‎所以我躺在甲板上 差点就死了

translation.en: But I lost a finger, and I got a bullet to my shoulder.
translation.zh:
‎但我失去了一根手指
‎肩膀里有一颗子弹

translation.en: [narrator] The best Churchill was hoping for
was to save 45,000 soldiers from death or capture.
translation.zh: ‎是拯救四万五千人不被杀死或俘虏

translation.en: But thanks to the navy, the little ships and the RAF,
translation.zh: ‎但多亏了海军、小船和皇家空军

translation.en: almost 340,000 were rescued.
[Saul] They got together enormous numbers
of sea-going craft run by civilians,
and these people sailed voluntarily across the Channel
at risk of life and limb to coordinate with the Royal Navy
translation.zh: ‎冒着生命危险和皇家海军合作

translation.en: to rescue a huge proportion of the troops at Dunkirk.
translation.zh: ‎在敦刻尔克拯救了大批部队

translation.en: [narrator] Göring is humiliated.
Having failed to stop the British evacuation from Dunkirk,
translation.zh: ‎没能阻止英军从敦刻尔克撤离

translation.en: Hitler now turns the army towards Paris.
In an effort to prevent their beloved capital city being reduced to rubble,
translation.zh: ‎希望阻止他们心爱的首都变为废墟

translation.en: the French flee, leaving it to be captured, undefended.
translation.zh: ‎法国人逃离了 任由巴黎贝侵占

translation.en: [Saul] There's no doubt that the French were aware
of the German use of bombing
at Rotterdam and also previously against the Poles at Warsaw
and the terrible damage that was done to those cities,
and they did not want the same thing to happen
to all the architectural jewels in Paris.
They declare it an open city and move the government further south.
translation.zh:
‎他们宣布巴黎打开大门
‎将政府南迁

translation.en: [narrator] The Germans march in on the 14th of June.
translation.zh: ‎德国人在六月十四日进入巴黎

translation.en: The French Government moves first to the City of Tours,
translation.zh: ‎法国政府首先来到图尔斯市

translation.en: and then to Bordeaux.
Prime Minister Reynaud is replaced by 84-year-old First World War hero,
translation.zh:
‎取代雷诺首相的是
‎一位八十四岁的一战英雄

translation.en: Marshal Philippe Pétain.
[Saul] Pétain is a bit of a defeatist.
He's pretty convinced that the French have lost the battle.
translation.zh: ‎他深信法国人已经输掉了战争

translation.en: The most important thing to do now is to avoid revolution,
translation.zh: ‎现在最重要的事就是避免革命

translation.en: avoid the French Army from collapsing completely,
and the best way to do that is to negotiate an armistice.
[narrator] The north of the France and the Atlantic seaboard
are now occupied by the Germans.
The south is designated as the unoccupied zone
and run as a puppet regime by Marshal Pétain
from the spa town of Vichy.
translation.zh: ‎马歇尔•戴恩在维西温泉小镇指挥

translation.en: Pétain's authoritarian regime replaces the French motto,
translation.zh: ‎戴恩的独裁政权取代了法国的口号

translation.en: "liberté, égalité, fraternité,"
with a new slogan, "work, family, fatherland."
translation.zh:
‎新的标语是
‎（工作、家庭和祖国）

translation.en: Hundreds of thousands of French workers are deported to Nazi Germany
translation.zh: ‎几十万的法国工人被驱逐到纳粹德国

translation.en: to work as forced labor for the war effort.
They replace Germans who were being enlisted to fight
on the Eastern Front.
The speed of the German victory was astonishing.
Blitzkrieg was a brilliant success.
[Sonke] German generals always had in mind,
"I want to have the perfect battle," so war is an art.
translation.zh: ‎“我想要一场完美的战争” ‎所以战争是一种艺术

translation.en: The Germans attack with an inferior army.
Inferior in numbers, inferior in quality,
but superior in their mentality.
We, as generals, just want to have the perfect battle.
translation.zh: ‎做为将军 想要的只是完美的战争

translation.en: And so, the whole war plan in 1940
translation.zh: ‎所以整个战争计划 ‎在一九四零年

translation.en: aimed for the perfect battle.
And it was possible, because the British and the French
translation.zh: ‎这是可能的 因为英国人和法国人

translation.en: did every mistake and made every mistake they could make.
[narrator] The Nazis exploit their triumphant victory over the French
to create a huge spectacle for the newsreels
which finally expunges the humiliating experiences
endured in the First World War.
[Sonke] The German victory over France
was the biggest victory of German military history,
translation.zh: ‎是德国军事史上最大的胜利

translation.en: so it was really an outstanding event for Germany,
translation.zh: ‎对德国人来说是了不起的事件

translation.en: and Hitler was quite clever to create a propaganda coup
translation.zh: ‎希特勒就如何签署停战协议

translation.en: of how they were signing the armistice.
translation.zh: ‎进行了非常聪明的宣传攻势

translation.en: It was not just done somewhere in a hidden place, signing a document,
translation.zh: ‎这不是在某个地方秘密签署一份文件

translation.en: but it was really made up for the propaganda.
[narrator] This time, it is Hitler's moment to gloat.
translation.zh: ‎这次轮到希特勒心满意足了

translation.en: In a repeat of the November 1918 Armistice,
translation.zh: ‎复制了一九一八年的停战协议

translation.en: he orders the very same railway carriage
back to the same place at Compiegne
where the Germans surrendered in the First World War.
translation.zh: ‎在那里德国在一战中宣布投降

translation.en: This time, it would be the French who would be paraded in disgrace
translation.zh: ‎这次是法国在羞辱中进行游行

translation.en: in front of the cameras.
[Sonke] He took the railway carriage out of the museum,
translation.zh: ‎他将火车车厢从博物馆里搬出来

translation.en: put it on the very place where it was used in the First World War,
translation.zh: ‎放到当时一战时它所在的位置

translation.en: and at that very place,
the French leadership has to sign the armistice.
And the symbol was, with that victory...
we, you know, somehow react on the defeat of the First World War.
translation.zh: ‎这是我们对一战失败的反应

translation.en: [Saul] There were cameras there, it was in all the press,
translation.zh: ‎那里有摄像机 所有的媒体都报道了

translation.en: and only a few days later, interestingly enough,
translation.zh: ‎就在几天后 有意思的是

translation.en: he decides to take the railway carriage
back to Germany and to destroy the site of the 1918 Armistice,
translation.zh:
‎带回德国并在一九一八年
‎停战协议签署的地方破坏

translation.en: which, of course, had always been a humiliation for Germany.
[Sonke] So now, we have won.
The war, which had started in 1914, we have won that war.
translation.zh:
‎从一九一四年开始的这场战争
‎是我们赢了

translation.en: So, it's a combination of the First and the Second World War,
translation.zh: ‎所以它将一战和二战合并了

translation.en: and we have won that.
And by this, we overcome the defeat of the First World War.
translation.zh: ‎通过这样我们克服了一战的失败

translation.en: Now, we are not defeated, we won.
translation.zh: ‎现在我们没有被打败 我们赢了

translation.en: And this awful event of having been defeated
in the First World War, it's over, it's passed,
translation.zh: ‎一战中的失败结束了 成为了过去

translation.en: and it's Hitler who's done this.
It's Hitler.
He is, you know, the greatest war leader ever.
translation.zh: ‎他是有史以来最伟大的战争领导者
